org.sakaiproject.conditions.api

Interface ConditionService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseConditionService

    public interface ConditionService
    Facilities for creating and storing conditions to be evaluated at some future point in time
    Author:
    Zach Thomas

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String PROP_CONDITIONAL_NOTIFICATION_ID
      Property for storing the notification id for the condition for this entity
      static String PROP_CONDITIONAL_RELEASE
      Property for whether or not to apply a condition on the release of this entity [boolean]
      static String PROP_CONDITIONAL_RELEASE_ARGUMENT
      Property for storing the argument that is bundled with a condition and used to evaluate it
      static String PROP_SELECTED_CONDITION_KEY
      Property for storing the selectedConditionKey for conditional release on this entity
      static String PROP_SUBMITTED_FUNCTION_NAME
      Property for storing the submittedFunctionName for conditional release on this entity
      static String PROP_SUBMITTED_RESOURCE_FILTER
      Property for storing the submittedResourceFilter for conditional release on this entity

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String addRule(String eventType, Rule rule)
      this is the ConditionService's facility for persisting rules in the current implementation, the Sakai event API is used to store a Rule as the action portion of a NotificationEdit In the long run, though, the condition service should probably handle its own persistence of rules.
      String getClassNameForEvent(String eventName)
      gets the name of the class that the specified event concerns itself with.
      ConditionProvider getConditionProvider(String providerId) 
      ConditionTemplateSet getConditionTemplateSetForService(String serviceId)
      returns the set of ConditionTemplates supplied by a condition provider the condition consumers will use these templates to allow users to create new conditions
      Map<String,String> getEntitiesForServiceAndContext(String serviceName, String contextId)
      allows the conditions consumer to access key-value pairs to use in a UI The key of each pair is an identifier for a particular entity in the target service, e.g. an assignment The value of the pair is a display name to use in the UI
      Set<String> getRegisteredServiceNames()
      return a set of names of services that have registered with the conditions service as condition providers
      Condition makeBooleanExpression(String eventDataClass, String missingTermQuery, String operatorValue, Object argument)
      factory method for producing a Condition object which
      Rule makeRule(String resourceId, List<Condition> predicates, Rule.Conjunction or)
      factory method to create a Rule which is a list of conditions, the id of a resource that the Rule applies to, and a Conjunction which just says whether the conditions are meant to be OR'd or AND'd together
      void registerConditionProvider(ConditionProvider provider)
      Condition providers call this method to register themselves with the conditions service, which makes their services discoverable by condition consumers Registration should typically occur at the time the condition provider starts up
      void registerConditionTemplates(ConditionTemplateSet conditionTemplateSet)
      method for condition provider to specify its set of ConditionTemplates

    • Method Detail

      • getRegisteredServiceNames

        Set<String> getRegisteredServiceNames()
        return a set of names of services that have registered with the conditions service as condition providers
        Returns:
        Set of names

      • registerConditionProvider

        void registerConditionProvider(ConditionProvider provider)
        Condition providers call this method to register themselves with the conditions service, which makes their services discoverable by condition consumers Registration should typically occur at the time the condition provider starts up
        Parameters:
        provider - the ConditionProvider to be registered

      • getConditionProvider

        ConditionProvider getConditionProvider(String providerId)
        Parameters:
        providerId -
        Returns:
        the named ConditionProvider, or null if the provider doesn't exist

      • getClassNameForEvent

        String getClassNameForEvent(String eventName)
        gets the name of the class that the specified event concerns itself with. For example, when a gradebook.updateItemScore is fired, the class we use to encapsulate that event is org.sakaiproject.conditions.impl.AssignmentGrading Getting the class name enables the condition consumer to instantiate an object of this type
        Parameters:
        eventName -
        Returns:
        class name that corresponds to the requested event

      • getEntitiesForServiceAndContext

        Map<String,String> getEntitiesForServiceAndContext(String serviceName,
                                                 String contextId)
        allows the conditions consumer to access key-value pairs to use in a UI The key of each pair is an identifier for a particular entity in the target service, e.g. an assignment The value of the pair is a display name to use in the UI
        Parameters:
        serviceName - conditions provider, e.g. 'gradebook'
        contextId - a Sakai context id, such as a site guid
        Returns:
        Map of strings, where the key uniquely identifies an entity, and the value is a display name for that entity

      • makeBooleanExpression

        Condition makeBooleanExpression(String eventDataClass,
                              String missingTermQuery,
                              String operatorValue,
                              Object argument)
        factory method for producing a Condition object which
        Parameters:
        eventDataClass - name of the class that will be constituted when this Condition is evaluated
        missingTermQuery - name of the operation that we're performing on the data, e.g. 'getScore' or 'dueDateHasPassed'
        operatorValue - name which identifies a boolean operator to use in the condition, e.g. 'less_than'
        argument - the value that the expression will be evaluated with. e.g. for a 'less_than' operator, argument might be an Integer like 79
        Returns:
        a Condition object that encapsulates the evaluation we wish to perform with the specified terms

      • makeRule

        Rule makeRule(String resourceId,
            List<Condition> predicates,
            Rule.Conjunction or)
        factory method to create a Rule which is a list of conditions, the id of a resource that the Rule applies to, and a Conjunction which just says whether the conditions are meant to be OR'd or AND'd together
        Parameters:
        resourceId -
        predicates -
        or -
        Returns:
        the Rule object represented by the included terms

      • addRule

        String addRule(String eventType,
             Rule rule)
        this is the ConditionService's facility for persisting rules in the current implementation, the Sakai event API is used to store a Rule as the action portion of a NotificationEdit In the long run, though, the condition service should probably handle its own persistence of rules.
        Parameters:
        eventType - an event name, like gradebook.updateItemScore. The Rule will be evaluated whenever that type of event comes over the wire
        rule - the Rule to be persisted
        Returns:
        a unique id used as a key for this Rule

      • getConditionTemplateSetForService

        ConditionTemplateSet getConditionTemplateSetForService(String serviceId)
        returns the set of ConditionTemplates supplied by a condition provider the condition consumers will use these templates to allow users to create new conditions
        Parameters:
        serviceId - the name of condition provider to request ConditionTemplates from, e.g. 'gradebook'
        Returns:

      • registerConditionTemplates

        void registerConditionTemplates(ConditionTemplateSet conditionTemplateSet)
        method for condition provider to specify its set of ConditionTemplates
        Parameters:
        conditionTemplateSet - the service's (e.g. gradebook) condition templates
